title: Gareth Southgate fears he will get just ONE full training session with some England stars before Germany friendly
text:

Gareth Southgate fears he will only get ONE full training session with some of his England players ahead of the prestige friendly in Germany. 
Football Association bosses set up the game in Dortmund on Wednesday, March 22, as part of a reciprocal arrangement with Germany but also to give England’s players an important test. 
But Southgate fears the value of the game and get together ahead of a World Cup qualifier with Lithuania will be diluted because of the big demands on his top players. 
Manchester United, Tottenham, Manchester City and Liverpool are all playing in a “Super Sunday” three days earlier meaning they will not be able to report up to St George’s Park until 48 hours before the Germany game. Skipper Rooney is among the players set to play on Super Sunday (Photo: The FA via Getty Images) Southgate is concerned the importance of the match could be diluted (Photo: Action Images via Reuters) 
Many of the England players will just have a “warm down” on the Monday at St George’s Park, train fully on Tuesday morning and then fly to Germany later that day with just one proper session under their belts. 
England will then stay in Germany the day after the friendly in Dortmund, have a warm down on Thursday before flying back to prepare for the Lithuania game at Wembley on Sunday March 26. 
Southgate will also be aware that if some players are carrying knocks or get injuries in Premier League fixtures the previous weekend then they may be saved for Lithuania game with World Cup qualifying points at stake.
